content.question: Both Gaulli’s Triumph of the Name of Jesus and Rubens’ Henri IV Receives the Portrait of Marie de’ Medici express emotional drama by

choices.label: using asymmetrical compositions focused on diagonals and contrast between light and dark
combining a two-dimensional painting with three-dimensional relief elements
depicting human figures inside a rational architectural space with a central vanishing point
placing classically depicted figures in mysterious and wild landscape settings

content.answer: using asymmetrical compositions focused on diagonals and contrast between light and dark

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
